intro: Elaeagia maguirei var. maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire’s broadleaf elaeagia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Elaeaginaceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by bright red or orange berries. It is typically found in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its ornamental value is appreciated in horticulture due to its attractive foliage and seasonal fruit display.
